Masters in Innovation Management and Entrepreneurship











PRIME
Masters in Innovation Management & Entrepreneurship, PRIME, is a STEM Masters of Science (ScM) degree based in Brown's School of Engineering



















PRIME
Masters in Innovation Management & Entrepreneurship, PRIME, is a STEM Masters of Science (ScM) degree based in Brown's School of Engineering








PRIME students experience the process of creating value from technology, learn how to develop embryonic ideas and execute how to bring these ideas to market. Core business skills in finance, strategy, marketing, decision making, globalization and management are provided to assure venture success. Students are given the opportunity to participate in a program established internship with a PRIME-partnering company during their studies. After successfully completing the program, international students may utilize OPT, Optional Practical Training.
Earn a Top-Ranked Master’s Degree with Flexible Enrollment Options:
Traditional face-to-face format on campus
Fully online modality that is structured for professionals
While completing the one year program, students participate in business immersion activities, including an internship course and a week-long trip to the San Francisco Bay area, where they interact with company executives, government representatives, and technologists, richly enhancing their classroom experiences. 
PRIME's dedicated space for students is equipped with the necessary infrastructure to carry out class assignments and projects. PRIME students also have access to the entire engineering user facilities, including one of the largest maker-spaces in the US, the Brown Design Workshop (BDW), to create prototypes. The Nelson Center for Entrepreneurship is available to further the mission of making entrepreneurship an essential part of the Brown experience.
PRIME graduates have secured positions in consulting, investment banking, health/medical companies, information technology, traditional engineering companies, small technology firms and as founders of new ventures.

  Healthy Brown


  “Healthy Brown” is a goal and a core value guiding efforts to ensure the health, safety and well-being of the Brown University community. Brown has developed and implemented public health plans based on the guidance of medical and public health experts for managing infectious diseases in a pandemic, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
